conclusion: Analyze forces acting on the copper rod when energized in the magnetic field.
The rod is horizontally suspended in a magnetic field perpendicular to the plane of the paper.
Identify gravitational force, tension in wires, and magnetic force.
Gravitational force acts downward, given by F_g = mg.
Tension in wires is T_0 when not energized, and T_0/4 when energized.
Magnetic force on the rod is F_B = BIL.
When not energized, 2T_0 = mg, so T_0 = mg/2.
When energized, 2(T_0/4) + F_B = mg, leading to T_0/2 + F_B = mg.
Substitute T_0 = mg/2 into the equation: mg/4 + F_B = mg, so F_B = 3mg/4.
Magnetic force equation: F_B = BIL, so 3mg/4 = BIL.
Direction of current must be from M to N to produce an upward force using the right-hand rule.
Final answer: Magnitude of current is I = 3mg/4BL, direction is from M to N.
